item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, February 26, 2025 at 11:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. The FFT Strikes Back: An Efficient Alternative to Self-Attention (31 points | 4 comments)
2. Telescope – an open-source web-based log viewer for logs stored in ClickHouse (48 points | 17 comments)
3. DeepGEMM: clean and efficient FP8 GEMM kernels with fine-grained scaling (316 points | 59 comments)
4. I Went to SQL Injection Court (900 points | 352 comments)
5. Page is under construction: A love letter to the personal website (101 points | 36 comments)
6. Iterated Log Coding (44 points | 14 comments)
7. Hyperspace (705 points | 369 comments)
8. Part two of Grant Sanderson's video with Terry Tao on the cosmic distance ladder (291 points | 46 comments)
9. Material Theme has been pulled from VS Code's marketplace (193 points | 145 comments)
10. Terence Tao – Machine-Assisted Proofs [video] (79 points | 7 comments)
11. A compendium of "open-source" licenses (7 points | 1 comment)
12. Launch HN: Browser Use (YC W25) – open-source web agents (183 points | 75 comments)
13. Understanding Surrogate Pairs: Why Some Windows Filenames Can't Be Read (46 points | 19 comments)
14. Ggwave: Tiny Data-over-Sound Library (189 points | 49 comments)
15. Hard problems that reduce to document ranking (261 points | 32 comments)
16. Bald eagles are thriving again after near extinction (229 points | 143 comments)
17. The journalists training AI models for Meta and OpenAI (11 points | 6 comments)
18. Gustatory Wisdom: Bruegel the Elder's Twelve Proverbs (1558) (11 points | 1 comment)
19. A CLI to quickly launch VSCode/cursor devcontainers (5 points | 1 comment)
20. The XB-70 (2019) (171 points | 99 comments)
21. The Deep Research problem (205 points | 82 comments)
22. Evaluating modular RAG with reasoning models (39 points | 6 comments)
23. Why are QR Codes with capital letters smaller than QR codes with lower case? (225 points | 53 comments)
24. Emergent Misalignment: Narrow finetuning can produce broadly misaligned LLMs [pdf] (129 points | 78 comments)
25. Embedding Python in Elixir, it's fine (281 points | 59 comments)
26. Modernist Cuisine: The Art and Science of Cooking (82 points | 58 comments)
27. Chicory: A JVM native WebAssembly runtime (177 points | 70 comments)
28. Show HN: MyCoder, an open source Claude-Code alternative (77 points | 15 comments)
29. Voker (YC S24) is hiring an LA-based full stack AI software engineer ( | hide)
30. New maps of the chaotic space-time inside black holes (122 points | 71 comments)
